entry.et: Middle English, from Old English æt; akin to Old High German az at, Latin ad

dt.un: used as a function word to indicate presence or occurrence in, on, or near staying at a hotel at a party sick at heart
used as a function word to indicate the goal of an indicated or implied action or motion aim at the target creditors are at him again
used as a function word to indicate that with which one is occupied or employed at work at the controls good at chess
used as a function word to indicate situation in an active or passive state or condition at liberty at rest
used as a function word to indicate the means, cause, or manner sold at auction laughed at my joke act at your own discretion
used as a function word to indicate the rate, degree, or position in a scale or series the temperature at 90 at first
used as a function word to indicate age or position in time will retire at 65

def.dt: :in any way or respect :to the least extent or degree :under any circumstances doesn't smoke at all
:an official turn at batting charged to a baseball player except when the player walks, sacrifices, is hit by a pitched ball, or is interfered with by the catcher three hits in five at bats
:the symbol @ especially when used as part of an Internet user's e-mail address
